title: Job Vacancies at International Energy Insurance Plc
content:
International Energy Insurance (IEI) Plc commenced business as Nigeria’s first Energy-focused Insurance Company, experts in first class underwriting solutions for offshore and onshore risks, as well as general insurance business. The Company’s security is backed by a consortium of local and foreign re-insurers led by African Reinsurance Corporation. We are licensed and regulated by the National Insurance Commission (NAICOM).

We are recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Underwriter

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Duties & Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Review insurance proposals, completed forms, supporting documentation, and risk information.
	Assess the nature of risk exposures using underwriting guidelines, actuarial principles, and historical data.
	Determine appropriate coverage limits, premiums, deductibles, and terms of acceptance.
	Decide whether to accept, decline, or modify applications in line with underwriting authority limits.
	Collaborate with brokers, agents, and marketing teams to clarify risk details and negotiate terms.
	Prepare quotations, underwriting recommendations, and policy documentation.
	Ensure accurate and timely issuance of policy endorsements, renewals, and cancellations.
	Maintain proper documentation of underwriting decisions and approvals.
	Track and manage renewal portfolios to ensure retention targets are achieved.
	Ensure adherence to internal underwriting standards, reinsurance arrangements, and regulatory requirements (including NAICOM guidelines where applicable).
	Monitor portfolio performance and claims trends to identify high-risk areas or emerging exposure patterns.
	Escalate unusual or high-value risks for senior review or reinsurance consultation.
	Work closely with claims, finance, marketing, and risk management teams to support business objectives.
	Provide technical underwriting support and guidance to sales teams and branch operations.
	Respond to customer and broker inquiries regarding underwriting decisions and policy terms.
	Participate in product development reviews and underwriting process improvements.
	Stay updated on industry trends, competitive products, and regulatory changes.
	Contribute to training initiatives for junior underwriters and operational teams.


Educational Qualification and Training


	Bachelor’s Degree in Insurance, Actuarial Science, Finance, Business Administration, or a related discipline.
	Professional insurance certification (e.g., CIIN, ACII) is an added advantage.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of relevant underwriting experience, in an insurance company.


Skills & Abilities:


	Strong analytical and risk assessment skills.
	Good understanding of underwriting principles, insurance products, and pricing.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Strong negotiation and decision-making abilities.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to meet deadlines.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and insurance underwriting systems.
	Strong attention to detail and compliance orientation.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: recruitment@ieiplcng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email

 

 

2.) Investment / Treasury Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Duties & Responsibilities


	Manage daily treasury operations, including cash positioning, bank account management, and fund transfers, to ensure adequate liquidity for operational and investment needs.
	Oversee and manage investment portfolios in line with approved investment policies, risk appetite, and regulatory requirements.
	Monitor cash flow forecasts, liquidity levels, and funding requirements to support operational and strategic objectives.
	Conduct investment analysis, including yield assessment, risk evaluation, and market trend analysis, to support investment decisions.
	Prepare periodic investment performance reports, portfolio summaries, and treasury dashboards for management review.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory investment limits, internal investment policies, and guidelines issued by regulatory authorities such as NAICOM.
	Liaise with fund managers, banks, custodians, and other financial institutions to manage investment transactions and treasury activities.
	Monitor interest rate movements, market developments, and economic indicators that may impact investment performance.
	Support asset-liability management initiatives and contribute to financial risk management strategies.
	Maintain accurate investment and treasury records, documentation, and reconciliations to support audit and reporting requirements.
	Support internal and external audit processes by providing investment and treasury-related documentation and explanations.


Educational Qualification and Training


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 5–8 years of relevant experience in investment management, treasury operations, or asset management, preferably within the insurance or financial services sector.
	Professional certification such as CFA, ACA, ACCA, or related investment qualifications is an added advantage.
	Demonstrated experience in portfolio management, liquidity management, and investment reporting.


Skills & Abilities:


	Strong knowledge of investment management and treasury operations.
	Excellent financial analysis and portfolio management skills.
	Strong understanding of liquidity management and risk assessment.
	Ability to interpret market trends and economic data.
	Strong decision-making and analytical abilities.
	Good reporting and presentation skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: recruitment@ieiplcng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email

 

 

3.) Admin / Procurement Officer

Job Location: Lagos 

Responsibilities


	Execute procurement activities in line with approved procurement policies, procedures, and budgets to ensure value for money.
	Identify, source, evaluate, and onboard reliable suppliers and service providers, ensuring quality, cost efficiency, and compliance with agreed service standards.
	Manage vendor relationships, including performance monitoring, contract administration, and resolution of service-related issues.
	Prepare purchase requisitions, purchase orders, and related procurement documentation, ensuring proper approvals and documentation.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date procurement records, vendor databases, and asset registers in line with internal control requirements.
	Coordinate office administration activities including logistics, facility management, inventory control, and general office support services.
	Support the management of office facilities, utilities, equipment, and maintenance services to ensure a safe and functional work environment.
	Prepare periodic procurement and administrative reports for management review, including spend analysis and vendor performance reports.
	Support internal and external audit processes by providing required procurement and administrative documentation.
	Ensure compliance with internal controls, ethical procurement standards, and applicable regulatory guidelines.


Educational Qualification and Training


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Purchasing, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of relevant experience in procurement, administration, or a similar role, preferably within a structured organization.
	Professional certification in procurement or supply chain management is an added advantage.


Skills & Abilities:


	Strong procurement, sourcing, and vendor management skills.
	Excellent negotiation and cost-control abilities.
	Strong organizational and documentation skills.
	Ability to manage procurement budgets and ensure value for money.
	Good knowledge of procurement policies and internal controls.
	Strong attention to detail and compliance orientation.


Method of Application
